Author: heguli97#5781
Content: There was a 51% attack on HUSH right before hush implemented dPoW replay attack protection. ü§î

Author: heguli97#5781
Content: It was Cryptopia's flaw the attack did the damage(allegedly) that it did. Cryptopia was using a confirmation number that was way too low, should have been 120 but was 20 I think.

Author: heguli97#5781
Content: It's pretty obvious that an exchange should use a higher amount of confirmations on a smallcap coin like ours.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <kh4567> Volume in cryptopia is extremely low...not just for hush but overall no volume

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> *volume in cryptopia is non existent as the markets have been offline since end of September

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> So it is a two pronged issue

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> 1- Cryptopia has markets offline & if people want to buy hush their isnt enough liquidity to buy on other exchanges
2- SINCE cryptopia is down, a lot of people who would like to trade their hush are unable to do so because it is locked up in cryptopia

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> so its a catch 22 of causality

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> this whole "hush is dead" argument is completely ridiculous & short sighted. People are just saying these words because they have sticking power that is relevant to the current situation: the inability go trade their hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Could hush have more direction? Yes. But the real issue is that we relied on Cryptopia for 95%+ of our liquidity. This single point of failiure from a central exchange has now caused us months of ongoing issues. It is up to Cryptopia to open up Hush Markets again- we can only do so much & hope that they do

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Everyone has a right to be upset- but lets all please focus our frustrations in the proper direciton. It is sometimes hard to remember that Hush is a 100% block reward coin. It is a miners coin. There is no founders fee or block reward that pays the team for their work OR exchange listings- @dukeleto has just been kind enough to do it all for free. Its something that 99% of the people in this discord to either forget or dont realize.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> Realistically, Hush relies on @dukeleto & donations to keep itself going. If introducing some sort of reward program that could go towards things like listing fees then maybe thats something we can talk about

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Duke made a bunch on his fork. No one works for free =)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> I'm saying... Don't expect much in terms of what the website is saying will happen.

Hush as a coin will be here. But there's no transactions- dead on that front too.
